newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan October index of leading indicators up.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan October index of leading indicators up.

text.p: Taiwan's index of leading business indicators, which forecasts peaks and troughs in the business cycle, rose in October from September, the cabinet's Council for Economic Planning and Development said on Wednesday.
The index increased 1.5 percentage points to 100.4 in October from September.
But the index of coincident indicators fell 0.2 percentage point to 101.3 from a month ago.
The council said the economy turned to a "yellow blue light" condition, indicating a possible slowdown from September's "green light" condition, which indicated a possible recovery.

Twenty-two percent of a sample polling of manufacturing executives said the economy would worsen, slightly up from 21 percent in September, while 19 percent said the economy would improve, slightly down from 20 percent a month earlier.
The rest said the economy would remain unchanged.
Many analysts have expected Taiwan's economy to gradually recover in the fourth quarter of 1996 due to more buoyant export orders and industrial output. -- Taipei Newsroom (2-5080815)
